title: Kazakhstan - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 5 February 2021, about 50 paramedics, ambulance drivers, and medics gathered outside the city health department in Almaty city in protest of unequal extra pay for health workers based on the record of direct contact with coronavirus infected patients, which protesters complained was unreasonable due to impossibility of knowing whether a patient was infected or otherwise. Protesters demanded equal extra benefits for every health worker regardless of the contact record. [size=about 50]
On 4 February 2021, about 50 activists gathered near the monument to Isatay and Makhambet in Atyrau city, demanding the release of all political prisoners in the country. [size=about 50]

Around 4 February 2021, a resident of Shalgai Karasu neighborhood in the city of Taraz in Zhambyl region was detained and assaulted by policemen while in custody for alleged cattle theft incident for which the victim complained police officers attempted to extract a forced confession out of him. In protest, the tortured victim committed a self-immolation act resulting in hospitalization. Police launched an investigation into torture allegations following the report of police brutality.

On 4 February 2021, supporters of an activist of the banned Koshe party protested outside the court in Shu township of Zhambyl region, demanding his release from detention and release of all political prisoners in the country. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, female protesters demonstrated outside the Ministry of Health in Nur-Sultan city against coronavirus vaccine and vaccination demanding the resignation of the country's Health Minister. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, new homeowners gathered outside their newly-built apartment building in Kyzylorda city, demanding the city authorities renovate and fix their poorly constructed homes after the original developer filed for bankruptcy. [size=no report]
On 3 February 2021, about 100 workers of the Shymkent Bus company protested at the terminal in Shymkent city, demanding pay raise and improved working conditions. [size=about 100]

On 2 February 2021, workers of the Bikkor service company, which is contracted by Chinese CNPC Aktobemunaygas company, protested outside the company's main office demanding pay raise. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, residents of the Kyzylagash village in Aksu district of Almaty region gathered at the nearby community farming equipment hub, demanding the central government investigate alleged corruption at the hub, leaving the village without agricultural equipment. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, parents of children with disabilities protested at the Talgar district's labor and social protection department's medical facility 4 in the town of Talgar in Almaty region, demanding subsidies for their handicapped offspring, which protesters argued they were eligible for. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, personnel of the Katonkaragay district hospital gathered outside the medical facility in the village of Katon-Karagay of East Kazakhstan region demanding extra pay for their service during coronavirus quarantine, which protesters complained they have yet to receive. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, teachers and parents of pupils protested at the middle school 29 in Shymkent city against the forceful transfer of teachers and children to the neighboring private school, demanding to halt such measures from the school's principal office. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, activists protested in Taldykorgan township of Almaty region against the Kazakh government's plan to launch a vaccination campaign against coronavirus with allegedly untested vaccine demanding the authorities use tested vaccine for coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, residents of the Tonkeris neighborhood near the town of Esik in Enbekshikazakh district of Almaty region protested near their homes against the community chair demanding his resignation for collecting fees from residents without providing bookkeeping records. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, dozens of Munayspetssnab company workers protested near the work camp outside the city of Zhanaozen in Mangystau region demanding pay raise and improvement of the work scheduling process. [size=dozens]

On 1 February 2021, residents of the local neighborhood in Nur-Sultan city protested outside their homes, demanding the city authorities relocate their households to safer locations and pay compensation due to environmental and health concerns, which protesters blamed on the power grid lines situated in the area. [size=no report]

On 31 January 2021, a group of activists protested outside the Central market in Aktobe city, demanding the release of a political prisoner and stop the persecution of opposition activists in the country. [size=no report]
On 30 January 2021, workers of the AMK-Munay oil drilling company protested at the Bashenkol oil field in Temir district of Aktobe region demanding pay raise. [size=no report]

On 30 January 2021, about 100 workers of the Chinese CNPC managed and partially owned KMK-Munay oil drilling company protested at the Kokjide oil field near the town of Kumsai in Temir district of Aktobe region, demanding a hundred percent pay raise. [size=about 100]

On 29 January 2021, residents of Kuat, Aliyit and Kazgorbaksha neighborhoods gathered outside their homes near the town of Esik in Enbekshikazakh district of Almaty region demanding the local authorities upgrade the administrative status of their settlement to a village and build a medical clinic and high school in the area. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, residents of the Tasken neighborhood in Shymkent city gathered outside their homes, demanding the utility company turn the natural gas supply back on after an abrupt service cut in the area. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, residents of Daulet village in Talgar district of Almaty region protested against bad roads and lack of power and natural gas supply in town demanding the local authorities fix infrastructure in the village. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, activists protested near the Monument to Raiymbek batyr in Almaty city demanding the Kazakh authorities release political prisoners and stop the persecution of opposition in the country. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, workers of the AMK-Munay oil drilling company protested on the work camp premises in the town of Bashenkol in Temir district of Aktobe region demanding pay raise from 67,000 Tenge to 150,000 Tenge due to inflation and low wages. [size=no report]
On 28 January 2021, workers of the KMK-Munay company continued their protest at the Kokjide oil field near the town of Kumsai in Aktobe region demanding 100 percent pay raise. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, residents of the outdated residential apartment building gathered outside their homes in Ayagoz township of East Kazakhstan region calling for the higher authorities to intervene in their social dispute with the local administration after their households were left without heating. Protesters complained the local municipality previously received funding to fix the issue, but it wasn't resolved. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, female protesters gathered at the local social services department in Medeu district of Almaty city demanding an explanation for cutting social subsidies to their households which protesters argued was illegal. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, new homeowners gathered outside their apartment building in Nursaya and Bereke neighbourhoods of Atyrau city demanding the city authorities fix the buildings due to poor quality of construction work and poor supply of utilities. [size=no report]
On 27 January 2021, workers of the KMK-Munay company protested at the Kokjide oilfield near Kumsai township in Temir district of Aktobe region demanding 100 percent pay raise. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, workers of a factory protested outside the plant in Ust-Kamenogorsk city demanding owed wages for four months of work and the company pay social taxes on their behalf which protesters complained wasn't done on time making it difficult for workers to access medical care. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, new homeowners gathered outside the incomplete residential apartment building in Turkistan city demanding the construction company finish the job which would enable them to move into their homes. Protesters complained they took out home loans and they were already making mortgage payments for two months. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, a group of housing scheme victims protested outside the regional prosecutor's office in Atyrau city calling for the authorities to investigate fraud perpetrator and recover their funds. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, relatives of imprisoned residents of Zhanaozen city gathered outside the Supreme Court in Nur-Sultan city demanding retrial of court cases involving their family members who were sentenced to 5-20 years in prison on fabricated charges, protesters argued. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, dozens of Ponzi scheme victims gathered at the office of Leader Capital 168 firm in Karaganda city demanding their funds back after police launched a criminal investigation into the company's fraudulent activity. [size=dozens]

On 26 January 2021, residents of the Montaytas village in Arys district of Turkistan region protested against the local farm's trenches in the area that was killing local livestock by dozens demanding the authorities eliminate trenches around the village. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, owners of the construction firms gathered in Aktobe city demanding the authorities resolve a dispute between the contractors and state agency regarding the partial refund of funds back to the agency after contractors delivered renovation services months ago. Protesters argued the state agency's claim was illegal. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, workers of the KMK-Munay company continued their labour protest at the Kokjide oil field near the town of Kumsai in Temir district of Aktobe region demanding 100 percent pay raise which the company management rejected but offered 20 percent increase instead. Protesters argued 20 percent was insufficient and warned the company of more protests if their demands aren't met. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, female protesters demonstrated outside the Ministry of Healthcare in Nur-Sultan city against vaccination for coronavirus demanding a meeting with the country's Minister of Health. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, workers of the Chinese CNPC and Yukon Energy Holding owned KMK Munay company protested at the Kokjide oil field work camp near the town of Kumsai in the district of Temir of Aktobe region demanding 100 percent pay raise. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, about 200 residents of Boleksaz village in Kegen district of Almaty region protested against the local farm after disease outbreak that resulted in the mass die-off. The protesters complained the disease might spread to the village and demanded the authorities probe the owner of a farm. [size=about 200]
Around 25 January 2021, supporters of a detained Kazakh activist demonstrated outside the city Prosecutor's Office in Shymkent city demanding his release from police custody. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, about 50 protesters demonstrated on Central square in Kokshetau city against coronavirus vaccination campaign. Protesters also demanded the country's government reject the legislative bill on domestic violence. [size=about 50]

On 25 January 2021, activists protested at the local horse track in Shymkent city against the city administration's plan to build housing development in the area demanding the authorities reconsider a proposal. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, activists of the unregistered Democratic Party of Kazakhstan (DPK) protested at the intersection of Abai and Nazarbayev streets in Almaty city demanding the dismissal of the newly-elected parliament, nationwide ban on land lease transactions involving foreigners and legalization of DPK in the country. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2021, residents of the local neighbourhood on Auezova street in Almaty city gathered outside the construction site of commercial housing demanding the city administration cancel the illegal project in their backyard. [size=no report]

Around 22 January 2021, residents of the Zhas-Kanat neighbourhood in Almaty city gathered outside their state-subsidized housing project demanding from the company and municipal services to fix unfinished construction job inside their apartments for which protesters complained they might be liable for. [size=no report]

On 22 January 2021, actors and actresses of the local drama theatre in Kyzylorda city protested outside the theatre against their director and management accusing them of creating a hostile environment at work and demanding their resignations. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, a Xinjiang-born female ethnic Kazakh refugee and activist, who had been involved in a public campaign of exposing China's internment camps for Turkic minorities, was attacked by unknown individuals near her residence in Almaty city. The injured victim was rushed to the city hospital.

On 21 January 2021, residents of the Kairat neighbourhood in Turksib district of Almaty city protested against the poor supply of electricity in the area demanding the city authorities fix the issue. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, medical clinic employees and small business owners gathered near the Kazybek wholesale market in Shymkent city calling for the city administration to reopen the local road closed a day earlier for construction. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, personnel of the medical clinic Demeu in Almaty city protested outside the facility against non-transparent withdrawals from their monthly paychecks demanding from the clinic management to provide full disclosure of bookkeeping records. Protesters also complained they were obliged to pay for routine renovation and maintenance at the clinic. [size=no report]
On 21 January 2021, a Xinjiang native male ethnic Kazakh activist was stabbed by about 2 unknown attackers in Nur-Sultan city. The victim was hospitalized with stab wounds.

On 20 January 2021, residents of an apartment building on Dosmukhambetov street in Atyrau city protested outside their homes against illegal construction activity inside the residential building demanding the city authorities intervene to stop unsafe construction. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, teachers of high school 30 and residents of nearby apartment building protested outside the school in Ust-Kamenogorsk city against a planned construction of commercial housing, demanding from the city authorities to cancel the project out of safety concerns. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, workers of the Askeri Kurulus Astana defence contractor protested near their employer's local branch office in Atyrau city demanding owed wages for months of work. Protesters complained the company failed to pay taxes and health insurance on their behalf, making it difficult for them to access medical care. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, hundreds of small business owners protested at the Kazybek wholesale market in Shymkent city against the city administration authorized shut down of the market and lack of access to their shops, demanding the authorities allow them back in to operate for another 3 months until relocation to a new facility. [size=hundreds]

On 19 January 2021, female protesters organized a protest in Turkistan city against the legislative bill on domestic violence which activists believe requires more time for public discussion due to its possible negative impact on the socially-vulnerable households if passed in the country's parliament. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, residents of the Asar-2 neighbourhood in Shymkent city protested near their homes against bad roads and lack of access to drinking water demanding the city administration fix the issues. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, workers of the Chinese XIBU oil drilling company protested outside the company's office in Aktau city demanding pay raise, bonuses, 50 percent pay during production slowdown and dismissal of Chinese workers first if mass lay-off occurs. [size=no report]

On 18 January 2021, about 50 residents of Altyn Besik neighbourhood in Almaty city protested against the university dormitory's construction in the area demanding the city administration build daycare or high school instead. [size=about 50]

On 18 January 2021, about 30 workers of a construction firm protested outside the company's main office in Atyrau city demanding backpay. The company managers explained protesters would be paid the partial amount but not the full salary due to delay with finances. [size=about 30]

On 18 January 2021, a group of female protesters gathered at the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection in Nur-Sultan city demanding officials clarify several concerns regarding the new draft of domestic violence law. The protesters argued that some regulations were unrealistic due to poor living standards and social disparities in the country. [size=no report]

On 18 January 2021, residents of the Kyzylagash village in Aksu district of Almaty region protested near their homes demanding the local authorities provide additional land due to a lack of pastures in the area after a private investor took over more than a thousand hectares of grassland nearby leaving villagers with no means to feed local cattle. [size=no report]

On 18 January 2021, parents of children and employees of a daycare facility protested outside a kindergarten in Shymkent city against its director, demanding her resignation due to poor care conditions and allegations of misconduct including verbal abuse and physical assaults of the employees. [size=no report]

On 17 January 2021, workers of a construction firm gathered outside the company's main office in Atyrau city demanding owed wages since September 2020, which protesters complained their employer's representatives failed to provide on time. [size=no report]

Around 17 January 2021, residents of Zhansugurov village in Aksu district of Almaty region gathered at the local administration demanding the authorities find individuals threatening protesters following suicide incident with the alleged involvement of a local policeman. Protesters complained that district police were neglecting the case. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, residents of the apartment building on Dosmukhambetov street in Atyrau city protested outside their homes against the construction project adjacent to the main building which protesters complained was unsafe, demanding stop to illegal activity. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, workers of a Chinese oil drilling company protested outside its headquarters in Aktau city, demanding pay raise and bonuses, which protesters complained haven't been raised for three years. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, retail shop owners protested at the Alash market in Shymkent city against unaffordable rent fees, demanding market's new management work with retailers to resolve the dispute. [size=no report]
On 14 January 2021, teachers and parents of students protested outside the school 5 in Shornak village of Turkistan region against the possible closure of the education facility. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, activists protested in Shymkent city against the detention of their fellow activist, demanding his release from police custody. Protesters called for the country's president to intervene in the case. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, residents of Bestamak village in Alga district of Aktobe region demonstrated against a nearby pig farm demanding the authorities shut it down due to public health concerns. Some community members organized counter-demonstration against the closure of the farm triggering brief scuffle between the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, parents of students protested at the local high school in the village of Shalkia of Zhanakorgan district in Kyzylorda region against the school principal, demanding her resignation due to poor performance which resulted in the unsatisfactory quality of education, protesters complained. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, residents of the local neighbourhood in Atyrau city protested outside their apartment building against high utility bills, demanding service provider resolve the dispute. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, residents of the local neighbourhood in Semey city protested outside their homes against unsatisfactory municipal waste management service, demanding the city administration maintain timely waste removal schedule in the area. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, residents of Karabastau village outside Shymkent city protested near their homes against lack of access to drinking water, demanding the local authorities supply drinking water. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, workers of a road construction company gathered at their employer's office in Almaty city demanding owed wages for seven months of work, which protesters complained the company failed to pay on time. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, residents of the state-subsidized housing project in Taldykorgan township of Almaty region protested outside rented cottages, demanding the local authorities repair or renovate residential units due to poor conditions inside their homes amid cold temperatures. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, railroad depot workers protested at the station in the town of Shalkar of Shalkar district in Aktobe region against upcoming layoffs, demanding the company and authorities preserve jobs. [size=no report]
On 12 January 2021, workers of the Yubileiny gold mine near Mugalzhar township in Aktobe region protested on the project premises demanding fifty percent pay raise. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, new homeowners protested outside the state-subsidized housing project in Bereke neighbourhood of Atyrau city, demanding city officials inspect the poor condition of their homes for which protesters complained they were making mortgage payments. [size=no report]
Police Forces of Kazakhstan (2019-) Prison Guards

Around 11 January 2021, a Kazakh activist was physically assaulted at the police detention facility 166/1 in Nur-Sultan city while in custody. Victim's attorney called for the authorities to investigate the incident.

On 10 January 2021, supporters of the banned Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan political group who gathered to protest the parliamentary election at the central stadium in Aktobe city where dispersed by the police. About 10 protesters were detained. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2021, about 20 activists staged a protest against the parliamentary election outside the city administration's office in Uralsk city. The police dispersed the protest and detained almost all the protesters. [size=about 20]
DPK: Democratic Party of Kazakhstan; Oyan Kazakhstan

On 10 January 2021, over 90 activists of the unregistered Democratic Party of Kazakhstan and Oyan Kazakhstan organized a demonstration against the parliamentary election near Respublika square in Almaty city. The police dispersed the protest and detained almost all protesters. Police forces also prevented about 20 activists of Oyan Kazakhstan youth group from joining the main protest in the area. [size=over 90]

On 10 January 2021, a Kazakh female activist was detained by policemen outside her residence in Nur-Sultan city and was transported to the Almaty district police station during which she was physically assaulted by officers. The victim reported upon release from police custody on 20 January that she was detained when she was on the way to vote at the local polling station.

On 10 January 2021, activists gathered on Central square in Kyzylorda city to protest the parliamentary election expressing their concerns regarding voter fraud. Protesters voiced their opposition to the ruling Nur-Otan party, raising the issues of political prisoners and land lease involving Chinese businesses in the country. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2021, a group of people gathered to protest near Youth palace Zhastar in Nur-Sultan city against the parliamentary election. About 5 protesters were detained by police forces for attempting to protest. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2021, a group of people gathered to organize protests on Ordabasy square and near Shymkent Plaza shopping centre in Shymkent city against the parliamentary election. About 6 activists in total were detained by police. [size=no report]
On 7 January 2021, activists and supporters of an opposition activist gathered outside the pre-trial court in Shymkent city demanding his release from police custody. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, workers of the companies from oil and gas industries protested near the oil refinery at the Karachaganak oil field in West Kazakhstan region demanding pay raise by 50 percent. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, about 10 supporters of a Kazakh activist gathered outside the Karatau district police station in Shymkent city demanding his release from custody. The activist's home was also raided by police earlier in the day. [size=about 10]

On 6 January 2021, about 20 female protesters gathered outside the Zhambyl regional state administration in the town of Taraz demanding the authorities bring back 21,000 Tenge subsidy per child and eliminate substitute social benefits for households with multiple underage dependents. [size=about 20]

On 6 January 2021, residents of the local neighbourhood near Ili-Alatau state park in Almaty city protested against allegedly illegal logging in the nearby apple garden and residential construction activity calling for the country's president to intervene and save the local forest from destruction. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, workers of the companies from oil and gas industries protested on the oil project premises near the town of Aksay in West Kazakhstan region demanding pay increase by fifty percent. [size=no report]

Around 5 January 2021, a local activist of the Ak Zhol democratic party was physically assaulted by policemen in the city of Taraz in Zhambyl region which victim argued was a result of his campaigning and distribution of election leaflets on behalf of the party in the city ahead of the country's parliamentary election on 10 January 2021.

On 5 January 2021, residents of Koktal neighbourhood in Nur-Sultan city protested against the local court-sanctioned electricity supply rate increase for their households, demanding the district authorities address and resolve their concerns. [size=no report]

On 1 January 2021, workers of a construction company gathered outside the Shu district administration in the town of Shu in Zhambyl region calling for the authorities to settle a labour case with the unpaying employer whom protesters accused of not paying wages for up to 6 months. [size=no report]

On 31 December 2020, workers of the Vesennya Aralchinskaya underground copper mining project protested on the premises near the town of Koktau in Khromtau district of Aktobe region demanding a full investigation of the deadly explosion at the mine, which took place on 30 December killing four miners and injuring one. [size=no report]

On 30 December 2020, residents of Bayan aul neighbourhood in Turkistan city blocked the local motor road in protest of lack of access to drinking water and poor supply of natural gas in the area demanding the city administration fix the issues. [size=no report]

On 30 December 2020, victims of a housing scheme protested outside the Mangystau regional state administration's office in Aktau city demanding the authorities recover their funds from a developer company. [size=no report]

On 30 December 2020, workers of the state-owned Uranium mine near the village of Kyzemshek in Sozak district of Turkistan region gathered on the mine premises demanding 100 percent pay raise or else workers will go on strike beginning 5 January 2021. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, victims of a housing scheme protested at the construction site of the residential housing project in Atyrau city demanding the city's law enforcement agencies locate a construction company's head to prosecute him for fraudulent activity and recover protesters' funds which they invested initially. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, LPG supply station owners gathered at the Mangystau regional state administration in Aktau city demanding the authorities address their concerns regarding additional LPG wholesale suppliers in the region which protesters argued would push the smaller LPG supply firms out of business. [size=no report]

On 29 December 2020, former students of the Innovation University, which was shut down previously by the authorities due to fraudulent activity, gathered outside the regional court in Kyzylorda city demanding to address their concerns regarding annulled Diplomas and recover tuition fees. Protesters complained the local government agencies failed to act on time, which left graduate students without degrees. [size=no report]
On 28 December 2020, workers of the Askeri Kurylys Astana defence contractor company protested at the headquarters in Nur-Sultan city, demanding back pay for several months of work. [size=no report]

On 28 December 2020, workers of the Askeri Kurylys Astana defence contractor company protested outside the company's branch office in the town of Sary-Ozek in Almaty region demanding owed wages for 4-5 months of work. [size=no report]

On 28 December 2020, a Kazakh male activist was assaulted by at least one unknown individual near his home in the town of Balkhash in Karaganda region which resulted in a concussion. Victim believes the attack was tied to his activism ahead of the country's parliamentary election on 10 January 2021.

On 27 December 2020, oil workers of a Chinese company gathered on the premises near the city of Kyzylorda demanding 100 percent pay raise. Workers complained their previous calls for wage increase have been ignored by the company management and local authorities. [size=no report]

On 26 December 2020, about 50 protesters demonstrated outside the Russian Consulate in Almaty city, demanding two Russian lawmakers apologize to the Kazakh nation for questioning Kazakhstan's territorial integrity on TV. [size=about 50]

On 25 December 2020, personnel of a medical clinic protested outside the facility in Atyrau city, demanding extra pay for their service during coronavirus quarantine. Protesters complained they come under pressure from the clinic management after their calls for extra benefits. [size=no report]

On 24 December 2020, victims of a pyramid scheme protested outside the city court in Aktobe city demanding justice and recovery of their funds from the fund, which protesters accused of organizing fraudulent activity. [size=no report]

On 24 December 2020, dozens of medics and personnel of the Kalkaman city hospital in Almaty city protested outside the medical facility demanding extra pay after contracting coronavirus infection while on duty during the quarantine. Protesters complained their pay stopped coming in since October 2020. [size=dozens]

On 23 December 2020, residents of the local neighbourhood in Auezov district of Almaty city protested against the construction of the commercial project in their backyard, demanding the company stop its activity, which protesters complained is close to their homes. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, activists of Namys Movement protested outside the regional state administration's office in Petropavl city demanding the Kazakh authorities rename Petropavl city to Kyzyljar following the Russian lawmaker's statement on TV questioning territorial integrity of northern Kazakhstan. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, residents of the Duman neighbourhood in Almaty city protested near their homes against the construction work on their road, demanding the city authorities and company provide better roads upon completing the project in the area. Simultaneously, residents of the local neighbourhood in Auezov district of Almaty city protested against the construction of the commercial project in their backyard, demanding the company stop its activity, which protesters complained is close to their homes. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, defaulting mortgage holders protested outside the Nur-Otan party office in Almaty city demanding a meeting with former president Nursultan Nazarbayev to address debt relief and forced eviction concerns. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, the fertilizer wholesale company's management and workers protested on the premises in Atakent village of Maktaraal district in Turkistan region against the shutdown of the customs railroad post-Ata-Meken on the border with Uzbekistan, demanding the authorities reopen the customs facility. Protesters complained they are out of jobs as a result. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, local farmers protested outside the Kyzylorda regional state administration's office in Kyzylorda city, demanding the Kazakh authorities address adequate and timely subsidies for the farmer community. [size=no report]

On 22 December 2020, victims of a financial services company gathered outside its office in Almaty city, demanding the authorities assist victims with the recovery of their funds from the firm. [size=no report]

On 22 December 2020, new homeowners protested at the newly-built state-subsidized apartment building in Saraishyk village of Makhambet district in Atyrau region, demanding the authorities fix the remaining issues in their homes after the construction company's poor quality job. Protesters complained new homes have no heating as well. [size=no report]

On 22 December 2020, around 50 women gathered outside the regional administration building in Mary disctrict of Aktau against the lack of flour, bread and drinking water in their villages. The officials did not come out to speak to the women but promised that they would work on the issue. [size=about 50]

On 21 December 2020, residents of Aiyrtau village in Ulan district of East Kazakhstan region protested against the plan to build a pig farm in the area, demanding the local authorities reject it out of environmental concerns. [size=no report]

On 21 December 2020, teachers of high school 4 in Shymkent city protested on the premises against their principal, demanding her resignation after a months-long labour dispute, which was ruled in teachers' favour by the local court. Protesters complained they were victimized by the principal, which led to the loss of social benefits for teachers. [size=no report]

On 21 December 2020, residents of Kamennyi Karier village residents outside the city of Ust-Kamenogorsk protested near their homes against lack of public transportation, medical care, and internet service in town, demanding the city authorities integrate their township into the city which would resolve the social issues. [size=no report]

On 21 December 2020, about 50 owners of restaurant and catering businesses gathered at the office of Chief Sanitarian in Uralsk city, demanding the health authorities lift coronavirus quarantine restrictions on their establishments, allowing them to operate. [size=about 50]

On 21 December 2020, about 10 supporters of detained activist gathered outside the Al-Farabi district police department in Shymkent city, demanding his release from detention after police took him into custody a few days earlier. [size=about 10]

On 17 December 2020, relatives and family members of local residents detained by the police protested in Zhanaozen city against injustice in court, demanding their realtives have a fair trial. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2020, muslim activists gathered at the local memorial in the village of Badam of Ordabasy district in Turkistan region, demanding police to allow protesters to conduct prayer dedicated to the victims of Jeltoqsan and Zhanaozen protests. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, municipal bus company drivers and workers protested on the terminal premises in Semey city demanding back pay for 3 months of work, or else protesters warned of more strikes until their demands get resolved by the city authorities. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, activists gathered in the business district of Taldykorgan city of Almaty region to commemorate victims of the Jeltoqsan protest in 1986, demanding to reschedule the upcoming parliamentary election from 10 January 2021 to March 2021 and ensure the transparency. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, activists gathered at the monument dedicated to Kairat Ryskulbekov in Semey city to commemorate the Jelotqsan protest in 1986, demanding to reschedule the upcoming parliamentary election from 10 January 2021 to March 2021 and ensure the transparency. [size=no report]
Oyan Kazakhstan; DPK: Democratic Party of Kazakhstan

On 16 December 2020, 200-300 protesters including Oyan Kazakhstan and Democratic Party of Kazakhstan activists demonstrated on Respublika square in Almaty city to commemorate the anniversaries of the Jeltoqsan and Zhanaozen protests. Oyan Kazakhstan members called for a transparent parliamentary election on 10 January 2021 and the release of all political prisoners. Police were on the scene to maintain public order while restricting protesters' movement. No detentions were reported. [size=200-300]

On 16 December 2020, about 10 parents of children with disabilities protested outside the Mayor's office in Nur-Sultan city, demanding the city authorities provide their families with subsidized housing. [size=about 10]
On 15 December 2020, dozens of municipal company drivers and workers protested at the bus terminal in Semey city, demanding back pay for November. [size=dozens]

Around 15 December 2020, a male resident of Zhetisay district was assaulted by policemen near the town of Zhetisay in Turkistan region upon which victim was hospitalized. Police denied the use of excessive force in the case of blaming a victim for resisting arrest on disorderly conduct offence.

Property destruction: On 14 December 2020, unkown individuals set on fire the privat car of Kazakh activist Esengazy Kuandyk in Almaty city. According to the victim, the incident was connected to his opposition to the government and critical views.

Security measures: On 27 June 2020, The Kazakh authorities closed down shopping malls, parks and markets in major cities due to the second wave of coronavirus in the country. On 5 July 2020, the Kazakh government reimposed coronavirus quarantine restrictions in the Almaty, Nur-Sultan and Shymkent cities. On 29 July 2020, Kazakh president Tokayev ordered his Cabinet to extend coronavirus quarantine in the country for two more weeks from 2 August.

On 26 June 2020, about 30 residents of the Shymkent city neighborhood protested outside the local high school against the authorities plan to use it as a quarantine facility for possibly infected patients with coronavirus demanding the city administration set up such facility elsewhere. On 18 June 2020, about 20 residents of the apartment building in the town of Lenger in Turkistan region protested outside their homes against construction of another housing project next to their building, out of safety concerns. [size=about 20]

DPK: Democratic Party of Kazakhstan; DVK: Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan
