On 17 June 2019, about 15 female protesters gathered in the park near the city administration in Shymkent city demanding the Kazakh government improve the state subsidized housing programme for the households with multiple children and provide low-interest rate financing for the socially vulnerable families that are receiving social subsidies. [size=about 15]

On 17 June 2019, about 15 residents of Kulsary township in Atyrau region protested against poor quality power supply and bad roads in the neighborhood demanding the local authorities resolve their concerns and fix the local infrastructure. [size=about 15]
On 12 June 2019, people attempted to protest the recent Presidential election of Kazakhstan by gathering in Shymkent city. Several were arrested. [size=at least several]

On 12 June 2019, about 15 residents of Kara-Bulak village, Taldyqorhan, Almaty region protested against waste of state funds on the local water irrigation infrastructure project and lack of irrigation water in the village demanding the local authorities fix the issue. [size=about 15]

On 12 June, protesters gathered across Kazakhstan, including Uralsk, protesting the early Presidential election. Reportedly, over a dozen were detained, including journalists covering the event and eventually later fined. During several days of protests, about 4 thousand individuals were detained across the country. No excessive violence was reported. The exact number of protesters was not announced. [size=no report]

On 12 June 2019, several protesters burned an election banner belonging to the presidential candidate Amirzhan Kosanov accusing him of cooperating with the country's authorities to help win pro-government candidate Tokayev on 9 June 2019 presidential election day in Kazakhstan. [size=several]

On 12 June, dozens of people were arrested in Almaty, in a location that was supposed to be a gathering point for protesters for events related to the recent Presidential election; nevertheless, arrests of civilians without banners and several journalists were reported. Authorities refused to comment.
On 12 June, people attempted to protest the recent Presidential election at a gathering point in Astana (Nursultan). Several were arrested. [size=no report]
On 11 June 2019, several people were arrested in Shymkent for attempting to protest the recent Presidential election of Kazakhstan. [size=at least several]

On 11 June 2019, about 15 residents of Chelekemir village in Ili district of Almaty region protested against poor air quality in the area blaming the municipal sewage company Topa Su for inadequate maintenance of the nearby sewage facility. Protesters demanded the local authorities address and resolve the issue. [size=about 15]

On 11 June, over a hundred of protesters gathered in Almaty, calling for release of a popular singer, who had been arrested during protests the day before. Law enforcers dispersed the protest and several of them were reportedly detained. [size=over a hundred]

On 11 June 2019, about 30 residents of Kungei yksham neighborhood in Karaganda city protested against bad roads, lack of water and power supply in the neighborhood calling for the newly-elected president Tokayev to intervene and address their social needs. [size=about 30]

On 11 June 2019, about 10 protesters gathered on the hill overlooking lake Kopa in Kokshetau city to demonstrate against the persecution and arrests of Kazakh activists and fellow protesters in Almaty and Nur-Sultan cities after the presidential elections in Kazakhstan on 9 June. Protesters called for citizens to support the protest movement in the country. [size=about 10]

On 10 June, protesters gathered across Kazakhstan, including Astana (Nursultan), protesting the early Presidential election. Reportedly, dozens participated, some were detained and eventually later fined. During several days of protests, about 4 thousand individuals were detained across the country. No excessive violence was reported. [size=dozens]

On 10 June, hundreds of protesters gathered across Kazakhstan, including Almaty, protesting the early Presidential election. Reportedly, dozens were detained and eventually later fined. During several days of protests, about 4 thousand individuals were detained across the country. No excessive violence was reported. [size=hundreds]

On 10 June 2019, a group of protesters gathered outside the Nauryzbaysky district police station in Almaty to protest against police brutality toward fellow protesters. They were detained and beaten hours earlier on Tole Bi street after major demonstration following the presidential election on 9 June 2019. Protesters urged the police to stop using excessive force against protesting citizens. [size=no report]

On 9 June, protesters gathered across Kazakhstan, including Aktobe, protesting the early Presidential election. Reportedly, over a dozen were detained and eventually later fined. During several days of protests, about 4 thousand individuals were detained across the country. No excessive violence was reported. The exact number of protesters was not announced. [size=no report]

On 9 June 2019, protesters gathered across Kazakhstan, including Shymkent, protesting the early Presidential election. Reportedly, dozens participated, about 20 were detained and fined. During several days of protests, about 4 thousand individuals were detained across the country. No excessive violence was reported. [size=dozens]

On 9 June, hundreds of protesters gathered across Kazakhstan, including Nursultan (Astana), protesting the early Presidential election. Reportedly, dozens of protesters, including some journalists, were detained and eventually later fined. During several days of protests, about 4 thousand individuals were detained across the country. No excessive violence was reported. [size=hundreds]

On 9 June, protesters gathered across Kazakhstan, including Almaty, protesting the early Presidential election. Reportedly, around one hundred participated, dozens of protesters, including some journalists, were detained and eventually later fined. During several days of protests, about 4 thousand individuals were detained across the country. No excessive violence was reported. [size=around one hundred]

On 9 June 2019, several election observer volunteers working for the opposition presidential candidate Amirzhan Kosanov protested against non-transparent ballot counting process at the polling station 115 in Toretam village of Karakshy district of Kyzylorda region demanding open access to vote counting. Protesters complained head of the polling station blocked them from monitoring the process. [size=several]
On 8 June 2019, about 100 workers of the crane rental company protested on the camp premises at the Tengiz oil field in Atyrau region demanding pay raise. [size=about 100]

On 7 June 2019, about 10 private transportation service operators protested in the town of Baikonur in Syrdarya district of Kyzylorda region against unfair treatment of the Kazakh companies by the Russian authorities that are leasing the Kazakh territory after dual agreement between the two countries to operate former Soviet cosmodrome until 2050. Protesters complained they were rejected during a bidding process for a contract which private bus operators insisted was discriminatory of the Kazakh businesses. [size=about 10]

On 7 June, a press conference on issues of social problems of mothers with many children was scheduled in Almaty. But many mothers came and wanted to speak to authorities by themselves. They refused to leave the room, so the authorities cancelled the whole event; but women refused to leave the building and tried to organize their own event and to discuss with the present journalists. Later they dispersed. The number of participants was not revealed. [size=no report]

On 5 June, a Kazakh activist was reportedly attacked after leaving a police station in Almaty, where she was called for an unspecified reason. She had to be examined in a hospital. Allegedly the attackers were unidentified women.
On 4 June, over 30 protesters, predominantly women and mothers, gathered in Aktau, demanding larger social support for families with many children. [size=over 30]

On 4 June 2019, a group of neighbors gathered in Aktobe to protest a planned opening of bookmakers in the area. They said that they would not like to have bookmakers close to their homes and schools. [size=no report]

On 4 June, dozens of protesters of Nursultan (Astana) gathered in the central office of the Nur Otan party, demanding a meeting with the party Presidential nominee. They wanted to discuss issues related to rule of law in the country. [size=dozens]

On 4 June 2019, several dozen of florists protested in Almaty and demanded that the authorities give them space for selling flowers to replace the kiosks that had been taken down. [size=several dozen]
On 3 June, dozens of predominantly female protesters again gathered in the center of Nur-Sultan, calling the government for increase of social benefits and housing. [size=dozens]
On 31 May 2019, a group of women gathered in front of city Akimat in Shymkent and protested the conditions in apartments given by the city for temporary stay. [size=no report]

On 30 May 2019, about 10 female protesters demonstrated at the local employment department in Kentau township of Turkistan region against bureaucracy and alleged corruption at the township's social protection agency demanding the authorities approve their applications for social subsidies in timely fashion. [size=about 10]

On 30 May, a group of unidentified people protested by placing a bilingual cardboard in the center of Almaty, stating 'Changes' and 'Kazakh Spring'. The sign was attached to a statue of Viktor Tsoi, a singer and a symbol of political reforms and freedom in 1980s. Similar posters have appeared in several cities of Kazakhstan since the announcement of President's resignation. [size=no report]

As reported on 30 May, citizens of Almaty were protesting against the planned construction of a new cemetery near their residential areas, emphasizing safety and sanitary concerns as well as increased traffic in the district. The exact number of protesters was not reported. [size=no report]

On 29 May 2019, about 20 homeowners in Karasu village of Sayram district in Turkistan region protested against the local administration's decision to annul their land ownership rights due to alleged illegal purchase of their properties. [size=about 20]

On 29 May, a social activist from Atasu, Karaganda oblast, was shot dead. His relatives claimed that this was not the first attempt to kill the activist. Later three local residents were charged with murder, one of them was revealed to be a former policeman.

On 28 May 2019, about 30 residents of Ornek village in Enbekshikazakh district of Almaty region protested against bad roads and lack of drinking water supply in the village demanding the local administration fix the issues. [size=about 30]

On 28 May 2019, 10-15 state backed mortgage programme policy holders protested at the Alatau district administration's office in Almaty city demanding a meeting with the head of the district to discuss mortgage payment deferment due to prolonged delay with the construction of their apartment building. [size=10-15]

On 28 May 2019, about 10 residents of Eskene village in Kyzylkoga district of Atyrau region protested against lack of attention from the local authorities to the social and environmental issues in the village demanding district and regional officials address their concerns. [size=about 10]

On 27 May 2019, 10-15 parents of students protested outside the Aktobe regional administration's office in Aktobe city demanding the country's upcoming new president Tokayev and the government lift restrictions on school dress for children after their kids were unable to attend school for wearing hijab. [size=10-15]
On 23 May 2019, a group of former employees gathered in front of a closed textile factory in Shymkent. They demanded that the factory is reopened. [size=no report]

On 23 May 2019, 20-30 construction workers protested outside the Zhambyl regional administration's office in the town of Taraz demanding their back pay for building a local park which protesters complained they have been waiting to get paid for more than six months. [size=20-30]

On 23 May 2019, 10-15 female protesters demonstrated outside the local social protection department in Turkistan city against months long delay to process their social subsidy applications demanding the authorities speed up the approval process. [size=10-15]

As reported on 23 May, a large-scale police raid against illegal migrants and criminals was conducted in Almaty. According to the police, about 300 individuals were taken to police station because of inappropriate documentation, of which about 59 were placed at a special detention center and 16 wanted suspects of various crimes were detained.
On 21 May, protesters gathered in the center of Almaty, calling for wider financial support and debt forgiveness for low-income families. Predominantly women attended the protest. [size=no report]

On 21 May, a dozen women protested in front of the government administration in Shymkent to demand better housing and social assistance. The protest happened a week after similar rallies were held in Astana. [size=dozen]

On 20 May 2019, about 20 residents of Kumshagal village near Taraz township of Zhambyl region protested against nearby mining project due to public safety concerns after death of a local fellow villager. Protesters demanded the authorities intervene to address the issue and build a fence around the project to protect their livestock. [size=about 20]

On 20 May 2019, about 20 homeowners protested outside their newly-built apartment building in Ainabulak neighborhood of Almaty city against possible eviction from their homes as a result of the commercial land dispute in the court between the developer company and previous landlord which is threatening their homeownership rights, protesters complained and called for the country's government and president to intervene in the case. [size=about 20]

On 17 May 2019, about 5 female protesters demonstrated outside the local social protection department in Karasu village of Sayram district in Turkistan region against alleged corruption at the department which protesters complained was hampering with their social subsidy application process demanding the authorities resolve their concerns. [size=about 5]

On 16 May 2019, about 15 disabled workers protested at the local state employment agency in Semey city against bureaucratic procedures to receive wages from employers which protesters argued was discriminatory of disabled citizens demanding the city authorities resolve the issue and remove additional taxes from their monthly paychecks. [size=about 15]

On 16 May, around 40 women gathered for a rally in the center of Nur-Sultan (Astana), demanding more generous social benefits for low-income families. Reportedly, law enforcers including anti-riot police were present, but did not interfere. [size=around 40]

On 16 May, a silent protest was held in a courtroom in Almaty, during pronouncing a verdict over activist. Activists taped their mouths with tapes with 'Shame' written. According to the photos provided, around two dozen of protesters participated. [size=around two dozen]

On 15 May 2019, about 300 workers of the Ziksto railroad service company protested at the employer's office in Petropavl city demanding back pay for months of work. Protesters complained it is not enough that the company pays them minimum wage but now they are unable to receive salaries. [size=about 300]

On 15 May, about 50 teachers and other employees of a local school in Almaty cancelled lectures and gathered for a rally, demanding immediate resignation of the director. According to them, they are constantly being humiliated and punished for no reason. [size=about 50]
On 15 May 2019, about 10 protesters demonstrated outside the city administration's office in Zhanaozen city demanding jobs for unemployed citizens. [size=about 10]

On 14 May 2019, about 30 residents of the local neighborhood in Turkistan city protested at the Mausoleum of Khawaja Ahmed Yassawi against the local administration's attempts to intimidate them and force to agree on set buying price for their properties. [size=about 30]
On 14 May 2019, 20-30 employees of a nursing home in Almaty city protested on the premises against pay cuts demanding pay raise for their work. [size=20-30]

On 13 May 2019, about 10 individuals gathered in Aktobe, demanding the ban of Jehovah's Witnesses. They claimed that they are victims and lost some of their private properties because of their membership in the group. [size=about 10]

On 10 May 2019, a group of people gathered in front of the Kazakh regional executive office in Aktobe city. The protesters demanded freedom for political prisoners. Allegedly 27 people were arrested by police, in the evening of the same day the hearing against them was held in the the administrative court. [size= around 27]

On 9 May, protesters gathered in Nur-Sultan (Astana), demonstrating against the government and the snap Presidential elections in Kazakhstan. Several protesters were reportedly detained, including journalists. Furthermore, during the protests, numerous media outlets were blocked in the country, including RFE-RL, vlast.kz, holanews.kz, informburo.kz and others. [size=no report]

On 9 May, protesters gathered in Almaty, demonstrating against the government and the snap Presidential elections in Kazakhstan. Several protesters were reportedly detained, including journalists. Furthermore, during the protests, numerous media outlets were blocked in the country, including RFE-RL, vlast.kz, informburo.kz and others. [size=no report]

On 9 May, protesters gathered in Aktau, demonstrating against the government and the snap Presidential elections in Kazakhstan. Several protesters were reportedly detained, including journalists. Furthermore, during the protests, numerous media outlets were blocked in the country, including RFE-RL, vlast.kz, informburo.kz and others. [size=no report]

On 9 May, protesters gathered in Aktobe, demonstrating against the government and the snap Presidential elections in Kazakhstan. Several protesters were reportedly detained, including journalists. Furthermore, during the protests, numerous media outlets were blocked in the country, including RFE-RL, vlast.kz, informburo.kz and others. [size=no report]

On 9 May, protesters gathered in Atyrau, demonstrating against the government and the snap Presidential elections in Kazakhstan. Several protesters were reportedly detained, including journalists. Furthermore, during the protests, numerous media outlets were blocked in the country, including RFE-RL, vlast.kz, informburo.kz and others. [size=no report]

On 9 May, protesters gathered in Uralsk, demonstrating against the government and the snap Presidential elections in Kazakhstan. Several protesters were reportedly detained, including journalists. Furthermore, during the protests, numerous media outlets were blocked in the country, including RFE-RL, vlast.kz, informburo.kz and others. [size=no report]

On 4 May 2019, about 40 residents of Koktobe village in Ordabasy district of Turkistan region protested against nearby gravel mine operation on the dry bed of the Boralday river demanding the local authorities stop such activity due to environmental concerns which may leave the whole village without access to irrigation water. [size=about 40]

On 3 May, residents of Zhanatalap village, Almaty region gathered for a rally, calling authorities to block entrance of trucks into and through the residential area. Reportedly, the increased traffic spoils local road and may be dangerous for the residents, especially children. According to photos provided, dozens of protesters gathered. [size=dozens]
On 1 May 2019, dozens of protesters gathered in Shymkent, calling for release of political prisoners and boycotting the upcoming Presidential elections. No detentions were reported. [size=dozens]

On 1 May 2019, about 10 protesters demonstrated near the city administration's office in Pavlodar city against upcoming presidential election involving the first president Nursultan Nazarbayev's nominee Kasym-Jomart Tokayev. Protesters demanded the release of all political prisoners. [size=about 10]

On 1 May, hundreds of protesters gathered in Nur-Sultan (Astana), calling for release of political prisoners and boycotting the upcoming snap Presidential elections. Numerous detentions of protesters were reported, sometimes even before the protests started. [size=hundreds]

On 1 May, hundreds of protesters gathered in Almaty, calling for release of political prisoners and boycotting the upcoming snap Presidential elections. Dozens of protesters were detained, sometimes even before the protests started. [size=hundreds]

On 1 May, hundreds of protesters gathered in Karaganda, calling for release of political prisoners and boycotting the upcoming snap Presidential elections. Numerous detentions of protesters were reported, sometimes even before the protests started. [size=hundreds]
On 1 May, dozens of protesters gathered in Aktobe, calling for release of political prisoners and boycotting the upcoming snap Presidential elections. No detentions were reported. [size=dozens]
On 1 May, dozens of protesters gathered in Semey, calling for release of political prisoners and boycotting the upcoming snap Presidential elections. No detentions were reported. [size=dozens]

On 30 April 2019, 15-20 residents of an aging apartment building in Atyrau city protested outside their homes against lack of attention to their safety from the local city administration due to unsafe conditions in the residential building. Protesters complained they have been requesting assistance on many occasions but were ignored repeatedly. [size=15-20]
On 28 April, several protesters were detained in Nur-Sultan (Astana), during a rally supporting two detained activists arrested and jailed over their political activities. [size=no report]

On 26 April 2019, about 15 former workers of the metal plant protested outside the Aktobe regional administration's office in Aktobe city demanding the authorities recover their wages from the former employer which protesters complained they couldn't receive for nearly four years. [size=about 15]

On 25 April 2019, 10-15 residents of Kainar village in Talgar district of Almaty region protested against bad roads, lack of drinking water supply and poor power grid infrastructure in town demanding the local administration fix the issues in their township. [size=10-15]

Between 23 and 25 April, over 500 riot police from the National Guard held a 'shakedown' operation in a prison in Zarechnoye, Almaty region, during which they tortured over 30 prisoners. Prisoners were reportedly severely beaten, salt poured in their wounds, forced to march while wear leashes, forced to lay down all day in the sun, and their heads dipped in toilet bowls with urine and excrement. Many prisoners were forcibly shaven. Several prisoners were later seen with injuries. Authorities denied that the event happened and said that the prisoners had cut themselves. [coded according to civilian's version]

On 23 April 2019, about 15 residents of the Belousovka township in Glubokovsky district of East Kazakhstan region protested against water pollution in the neighborhood which protesters blamed the local mine plant for demanding the authorities address the environmental issue. [size=about 15]

On 23 April 2019, about 10 residents of Koksay village in Karasay district of Almaty region protested against nearby landfill demanding the local administration remove it from the neighborhood due to environmental and public health concerns. [size=about 10]

On 23 April 2019, 20-30 homebuyers protested outside an unfinished apartment building in Petropavl city against unexpected construction delay demanding the city administration intervene to resolve the issue or else refund their funds which protesters have invested in the building. [size=20-30]

On 22 April, dozens of people held a protest outside the courthouse in Almaty in support of two activists who had been detained the day before for hanging up a poster that read 'You cannot run from the truth' at the Almaty marathon. [size=dozens]
On 21 April, in Almaty, Kazakhstan four women were arrested for erecting a banner during a marathon that read 'You cannot run from the truth'. Two of them were sentenced to 15 days in jail. [size=4]

On 16 April 2019, 5-10 residents of the neighborhood on the outskirts of Kyzylorda city protested against forced evicition and demoltion of their properties refusing to vacate homes and demanding the local authorities provide adequate compensation for relocation. [size=5-10]

On 15 April 2019, about 30 residents protested near their homes in the town of Taldykorgan in Amaty region against lack of water and power supply in their neighborhood demanding the town admnistration fix the issue. [size=about 30]
On 14 April, law enforcers detained 42 natives of Tajikistan in Almaty, checking their residence permit. Some of them later complained of being humiliated and insulted during lengthy interrogations.

On 12 April 2019, about 30 residents of Talgar township in Almaty region protested near the town administration against two-week long disruption of power supply to seven hundred households in their neighborhood demanding the authorities investigate the utility company. [size=about 30]

On 11 April 2019, about 20 residents of Maidantal neighborhood in the town of Kentau of Turkistan region protested against unfair distribution of water for irrigation based on the size of the agricultural land. Protesters demanded the local authorities stop such discrimination accusing officials of corruption. [size=about 20]

On 11 April 2019, about 15 female protesters demonstrated at the Ministry of Social Protection in Nur-Sultan city demanding child subsidies in the amount of 21000 Tenge per child and social assistance from the government. [size=about 15]

On 10 April 2019, about 10 residents of Kyzylorda city neighborhood protested against nearby water filled landfill demanding the local authorities resolve the issue due to public health concerns. [size=about 10]

On 10 April 2019, about 25 cattle farmers and residents of Akchulak village in Bayzak district of Zhambyl region protested against lack of grazing land for their livestock demanding the authorities address their concerns after nearby pastureland was taken over by the private company. [size=about 25]

On 9 April 2019, 15-20 residents of Ayir village in Karkaraly district of Karagandy region protested against the local Altay Polymetal rare-earth mining project due to water pollution in the area triggering fear of water source contamination. Protesters demanded the company address and resolve their concerns or else shut down the project. [size=15-20]

On 3 April 2019, 15-20 residents of Panfilovo village in Talgar district of Almaty region protested against the local paper plant due to increased traffic through the neighborhood and water pollution which contaminated nearby lake. [size=15-20]

Around 2 April 2019, about 10 activists staged a protest in Almaty city against the political persecution of domestic opposition demanding the Kazakh government release all political prisoners. [size=about 10]

On 1 April, a group of activists and journalists gathered in front of a court in Nur-Sultan (Astana) in order to support their colleague. The exact number of supporters was not revealed. The journalist was later fined for activities related to her work. [size=a group]

Around 1 April 2019, dozens of employees of the Chinese oil company managed project protested near their field camps near Aktau city in Mangystau region demanding pay raise by thirty percen. Protesters threatened the company with a strike. [size=dozens]

On 28 March 2019, about 10 residents of the local neighborhood in Aktobe city protested against construction works in the area which would cut off entire block of three hundred households from the city due to destruction of the only road that locals use to get to the city. Protesters demanded the city authorities build them a bridge to compensate their needs. [size=about 10]

On 27 March 2019, about 30 retail shop owners protested at the Arlan clothing market in Almaty city against relocation of their shops to another location which protesters categorically opposed to demanding the market management provides official documents explaining reasons for such plan. [size=about 30]

On 26 March 2019, about 20 daycare employees protested outside their work facility in Aktobe city against privatization of daycare despite previous assurances from the authorities that the state-owned education organizations will not be privatized. [size=about 20]

On 22 March, an unauthorized rally against renaming the country's capital Astana to Nursultan was held in Shymkent during the celebration of the holiday Nauryz. Dozens of protesters were detained by the police officers during the rally and taken to the police department. [size=dozens]

On 22 March 2019, several people were detained by the city police in Aktobe city for protesting near the main square against renaming the country's capital Astana after first president Nursultan Nazarbayev. [size=no report]

On 22 March, an unauthorized rally against renaming the country's capital Astana to Nursultan was held in Astana during the celebration of the holiday Nauryz. Many of the protesters were detained by the police officers during the rally and taken to the police department. [size=no report]

On 22 March, an unauthorized rally against renaming the country's capital Astana to Nursultan was held in Almaty during the celebration of the holiday Nauryz. Around 30 protesters were detained by the police officers during the rally and taken to the police department. [size=around 30]
AP; RFE/RL; AFP; Interfax; BBC News

On 21 March, an unauthorized rally against renaming the country's capital Astana to Nursultan was held by 20 protesters in front of the Astana city hall. Police detained almost all of the protesters. [size=20]
AFP; AP; BBC News; Interfax; RFE/RL

On 21 March, an unauthorized rally against renaming the country's capital Astana to Nursultan was held in Almaty. Many of the protesters were detained by the police officers during the rally and taken to the police department. [size=no report]

On 19 March 2019, about 30 residents and farmers of the Akjol village near Abai township of Keles district of Turkistan region protested against lack of irrigation water supply which protesters complained is having a negative impact on their crops demanding the authorities address their concerns. [size=about 30]

On 19 March 2019, 15-20 retired army officers and their family members protested at the army base 61993 in Almaty city demanding the state subsidized housing and compensation for years of service in the military. Protesters complained they do not own homes nor have received sufficient pay to sustain a living after retirement. [size=15-20]

On 18 March 2019, about 20 residents of Kokjaidak village in Aksu district of Almaty region protested against unequal agricultural land distribution in favor of the bigger companies in the district demanding the authorities stop discriminating villagers. Protesters called for equal access to every local resident. [size=about 20]

On 14 March 2019, about 15 female protesters demonstrated outside the town administration in Chubarsu village of Ordabasy district in Turkistan region against bureaucratic hurdles involving registration documents to receive state subsidies for the households with multiple children. [size=about 15]

On 13 March 2019, about 10 handicapped residents of Shymkent city protested at the local clinic for special needs citizens calling for the health authorities to make hospitals and medical facilities more accessbile for the people with disabilities. [size=about 10]

On 12 March, protesters gathered in front of the police station in Zhanaozen, demanding immediate release of a journalist covering ongoing protests in the city. The exact number of protesters was not reported. [size=no report]

Around 12 March 2019, about 15 homeowners protested at the local administration in the town of Taraz in Zhambyl region against demolition of their homes demanding the authorities backdown on their original plan. [size=about 15]

On 12 March 2019, about 20 residents of Sholakozek village in Aksu district of Almaty region protested near their homes against spending of budget funds on the water supply infrastructure in their village which protesters argued was unnecessary. Protesters called for the authorities to spend funds on more needed projects in the area. [size=about 20]

On 12 March 2019, about 20 women protested at the social protection service department in Shymkent city against subsidy payment delay blaming local officials for mismanagement and demanding their subsidies paid on time. [size=about 20]

On 11 March, dozens of residents of Zhanaozen gathered in the city center, demanding a meeting with the akim (head of local administration) and adoption better employment policy. The Head did not appear, but very shortly after dispersal of the crowd, a journalist, covering the event, was detained and kept for hours at the police station and later fined for violation of law on public events. [size=dozens]

On 10 March, a prominent activist and the head of the unregistered movement Atazhurt Eriktileri (Volunteers of the Fatherland) was arrested in Almaty and charged with ethnic hatred - due to his frequent reports on camps in China. Most likely he was attacked during the detention, because there were found blood traces in his hotel room. The office of the movement was searched the same day. Bilash himself was later put under house arrest, without any charges officially announced.

On 7 March 2019, about 15 flower sellers protested near their makeshift shops in Alatau district of Almaty city against the local district administration's ban on selling flowers at the location. Protesters complained police forced them out of their traditional location inflicting financial losses on them. [size=about 15]

On 6 March 2019, about 30 residents of Talgar district protested in the village of Aiganym in Almaty region against bad roads in their neighborhoods demanding the local administration fix the roads in the area. [size=about 30]

On 6 March 2019, about 20 residents of Tauelsizdike area of Shymkent city protested at the local pig farm demanding the authorities shut it down due to public health concerns in the neighborhood. [size=about 20]

On 5 March 2019, 15-20 residents of Ordabasy district of Turkistan region protested near the village of Badam against the Chinese funded lead processing plant in the area expressing concerns for possible water pollution in the villages if plant proceeds to operate. Protesters demanded the district authorities shut down the project. [size=15-20]

On 1 March, a protest of around 40 people was organized near the main entrance of the utility company in Uralsk. Some 40 machine operators of the utility company refused to start working and gathered at the main entrance of the utility company demanding to cancel the decision of the management of the company to temporarily transfer the machine operators to the category of general workers. [size=around 40]

On 28 February, three women held a picket protest in Astana near the building of the Supreme court. They were trying to turn attention of the court as well as the government to alleged injustices that happened to them. [size=3]

On 27 February, the chief editor of a local newspaper in Alga was hit in the face by an unknown person on the doorstep of her house. She is known to be critical of local authorities concerning the privatization of oil companies.

On 27 February 2019, 5-10 mostly female protesters demonstrated outside the local administration's office in Taraz township of Zhambyl region demanding better social support for the vulnerable households and political reforms in the country's government. [size=5-10]
On 27 February 2019, about 100 protesters demonstrated outside the city administration's office in Zhanaozen city demanding a meeting with a Mayor to discuss unemployment. [size=about 100]
AKIpress; Fergana News; TAG News Agency; Ozodagon; BBC News; The Times of Central Asia; RFE/RL

On 27 February, a protest of dozens people was organized in front of the Nur Otan ruling party building in Almaty. Referring to the deaths of five children in a fire in Astana on February 4th, protesters accused the government of ignoring needs of ordinary people. The representative of the prosecutor's office stated that the meeting was 'illegal'. The police detained some 30 protesters and took them to the police department. [size=dozens]
RFE/RL; The Times of Central Asia; Fergana News; TAG News Agency; BBC News

On 27 February, a protest of dozens people was organized near the Independence Palace, which hosted the Nur Otan ruling party congress in Astana. Referring to the deaths of five children in a fire in Astana on February 4th, protesters accused the government of ignoring the needs of ordinary people. After some time the protest was dispersed by the police with some 30 protesters detained and taken to the police department. [size=dozens]

On 21 February 2019, about 40 home buyers protested at the residential apartment housing project's construction site in Nur-Sultan city demanding the Shar-Kurylys developer company refund their investments in the housing project due to unforeseen delays. [size=about 40]

On 21 February 2019, about 20 residents of Josaly village in Karmakshy district of Kyzylorda region protested against the Mayor of township demanding her resignation over allegations of abuse of office and mismanagement of funds which Mayor has denied. [size=about 20]
RFE/RL; Interfax; The Times of Central Asia; BBC News; TAG News Agency

Between 18 and 26 February, dozens of Zhanaozen residents held protests across the city. The protesters demanded that the authorities provide them with high-wage jobs. During the protests, 16 people were detained by the police. In addition, the police detained two correspondents of Radio Free Europe while they were covering protests. [size=dozens]

On 20 February, a protest was organized near the Republic Palace in Almaty, which hosted the meeting of the city akim (the head of a local government) with local residents. The protesters demanded termination of building up the Kok-Zhailiau tract in Almaty's foothills. Several of them were detained by the police and taken to the police department. [size=no report]
On 19 February 2019, about 30 residents of Zhanaozen city protested outside the city administration's office demanding jobs with sustainable wages. [size=about 30]

On 18 February 2019, about 7 victims of the Capital to Life housing fraud scheme protested near the Aktobe regional prosecutor's office in Aktobe city demanding the authorities investigate the company for fraudulent activity and recover their funds. [size=about 7]

On 18 February, a group of mothers and women gathered near the building of the local administration in Almaty, demanding better social services and support for single mothers and large families. The exact number of protesters was not reported. [size=a group]

On 15 February, hundreds of protesters, mostly women and mothers, came to protest in the center of Astana. They demanded improvement of living conditions of families and higher support from the government. The rally followed a tragic event that took place several days before, when five children died. [size=hundreds]
On 15 February, hundreds of Zhanaozen residents held protests across the city demanding from the authorities to provide them with high-wage jobs [size=hundreds].

On 12 February 2019, more than 20 residents of the Karasay district protested near their homes in the town of Kaskelen against the local utility company's overcharge and fees for power and water supply demanding the district administration intervene in the dispute. [size=more than 20]

On 12 February 2019, about 10 construction workers protested at the housing project site in the town of Atbasar in Aqmola region demanding the company pay owed wages which protesters complained they have been unable to receive for two months. [size=about 10]

As reported on 12 February, media in Kazakhstan [coded to Astana] were forbidden to cover protests of the mothers and their supporters who had been protesting across the country for several days in the aftermath of a deadly fire.

On 11 February, a string of rallies was organized across Kazakhstan, including Karaganda. Protesters were predominantly women and mothers, demanding improvement of living conditions of families and higher support from the government. The rallies followed a tragic event that took place several days before, when five children died. The exact number of protesters was not revealed. [size=no report]

On 11 February, a string of rallies was organized across Kazakhstan, including Aktobe. Protesters were predominantly women and mothers, demanding improvement of living conditions of families and higher support from the government. The rallies followed a tragic event that took place several days before, when five children died. The exact number of protesters was not revealed. [size=no report]

On 11 February, a string of rallies was organized across Kazakhstan, including Astana. Protesters were predominantly women and mothers, demanding improvement of living conditions of families and higher support from the government. The rallies followed a tragic event that took place several days before, when five children died. The exact number of protesters was not revealed. [size=no report]

On 11 February, a string of rallies was organized across Kazakhstan, including Almaty. Protesters were predominantly women and mothers, demanding improvement of living conditions of families and higher support from the government. The rallies followed a tragic event that took place several days before, when five children died. The exact number of protesters was not revealed. [size=no report]

On 11 February 2019, a string of rallies was organized across Kazakhstan, including Shymkent. Protesters were predominantly women and mothers, demanding improvement of living conditions of families and higher support from the government. The rallies followed a tragic event that took place several days before, when five children died during a fire when their working parents were not at home. On 9 February 2019, about 20 female protesters demonstrated outside the Astana concert hall in Nur-Sultan city demanding social support for households with multiple children and state-subsidized housing for socially vulnerable families. [size=about 20]

On 8 February 2019, 5-10 local residents protested at the Kazaly district administration's office in Ayteke Bi township in Kyzylorda region against the natural gas supply project delay demanding the authorities speed up the implementation process. [size=5-10]

On 8 February, dozens of protesters, mostly women and mothers, came to protest in the center of Almaty. They demanded improvement of living conditions of families and higher support from the government. The rally followed a tragic event that took place several days before, when five children died. [size=dozens]

On 7 February 2019, 100-200 workers of the engineering and construction company protested at their work camp near the town of Aksay in Borili district of West Kazakhstan region demanding pay raise. [size=100-200]

On 7 February 2019, 5-10 workers of the Zhana Tas extractive company protested at the Aktobe regional administration's office in Aktobe city calling for the local authorities to assist them with retrieval of owed wages from the former employer which protesters complained they weren't able to receive for more than seven months. [size=5-10]

On 6 February, protesters spontaneously gathered in the center of Astana. The crowd, consisted predominantly of women and mothers, demanded improvement of living conditions of families and higher support from the government. The rally followed a tragic event that took place several days before, when five children died. Hundreds protesters were reported. [size=hundreds]

On 6 February 2019, several female protesters demonstrated outside the Mayor's Office in Shymkent city demanding child subsidy increase and job assistance for households with multiple children. [size=several]

On 6 February, protesters gathered in the center of Almaty. The crowd, consisted predominantly of women and mothers, demanded improvement of living conditions of families and higher support from the government. The rally followed a tragic event that took place several days before, when five children died. Dozens of protesters were reported. [size=dozens]

On 5 February 2019, 10-15 women protested at the funeral in Nur-Sultan city for five children who have died in a home fire incident day earlier against lack of social support from the Kazakh government to the working families with multiple children. Protesters blamed the authorities for not paying enough attention to the needs of socially vulnerable households. [size=10-15]

On 5 February 2019, about 20 grocery shops owners protested outside the Tabys bazaar's management office in Aktobe city against high rent and demanded from market owner to lower rental fee. [size=about 20]

On 1 February 2019, about 10 residents with disability and their relatives protested at the local administration in the town of Kentau in Turkistan region demanding disability pay increase and job assistance. Protesters complained it's difficult to sustain a living on 17000 Tenge per month. [size=about 10]

On 29 January 2019, 5-10 maintenance workers protested at the Aktobe regional administration's office in Aktobe city demanding wages for their work which they have been waiting for more than six months. Protesters complained a contractor failed to pay their salaries after securing a contract for the authorities. [size=5-10]

As reported on 29 January, a civil activist was fired at by unknown gunmen while in his home in Balpik Bi, Koksu district, Almaty region. He was known to be critical of local authorities. No injuries were reported.

On 25 January, a resident of Aktobe was detained and tortured by few local law enforcers in order to provide confession to an alleged crime. The incident was investigated and in September the law enforcers were sentenced to various years in prison.

On 24 January 2019, about 15 new homeowners protested outside their apartment building in Kentau township of Turkistan region against lack of heat in their flats and electricty supply overbilling demanding the town administration resovle their concerns. [size=about 15]

On 22 January 2019, about 20 employees of the state-run daycare protested on the premises in the village of Kulan in Zhambyl region against shut down of the facility due to unsafe working conditions which protesters disagreed with demanding the authorities keep daycare running. [size=about 20]

On 22 January 2019, 20-30 retired army officers and their family members protested at the army base in Sary-Ozek township of Kerbulak district of Almaty region against proposed subsidized housing package which protesters categorically opposed to demanding the Ministry of Defense provides compensation to them instead of overpriced apartment homes. [size=20-30]

On 18 January 2019, about 15 residents of the local neighborhood in Atyrau city protested against power supply fraud in their neighborhood which resulted in overbilling of many households. [size=about 15]

On 18 January 2019, about 30 homeowners protested at the city administration's office in Turkistan city demanding the authorities compensate them properly based on the market housing prices for their properties after launch of the state backed buyout in the parts of the city for development purposes. [size=about 30]

On 18 January 2019, 5 residents of Baikonur township in Kyzylorda region were attacked and assaulted in two separate incidents by the Russian police which were reported as police brutality cases by the victims. Such occurrences have happened to other locals in the past. The Russian police are operating in the area since 1991 after the lease agreement between Russia and Kazakhstan which granted Moscow rights to manage Baikonur Cosmodrome until 2050.

On 16 January 2019, about 20 workers protested outside the metal plant in Kurayli township of Aktobe region demanding their wages for months work and calling for the authorities to assist them with recovering back pay from the company. [size=about 20]

On 15 January 2019, 20-30 tenants of the residential apartment building in Koksay district of Shymkent city protested against eviction of their families and scheduled demolition of the building after homeownership dispute between the local authorities and tenants. [size=20-30]

On 11 January 2019, about 15 cattle farmers from Makhambet, Issatau and Makhat districts protested near the town of Makhambet in Atyrau region against recurring incidence of cattle theft in the area and police corruption which protesters blamed for losses due to alleged collusion between the local officials and criminal groups. [size=about 15]

On 9 January 2019, about 20 landowners protested at the local administration in Kasymbek Datka village in Turkistan region against a fraudulent transaction involving their land properties by the local businessman whom protesters accused of fraud and demanded the authorities intervene to get their properties back. [size=about 20]

On 6 January, about 200 people gathered at one of the Karaganda police departments, demanding to punish those responsible for the murder committed shortly before the New Year. The incident occurred on the night of December 31 in one of the restaurants of Karaganda, where a fight broke out between drunk guests, resulting in a murder of a 23-year-old Kazakh by an Armenian. [size=about 200]

On 4 January, a video appeared on YouTube of a protest of around 30 residents of Raiymbek district, Almaty region [coded to district capital Kegen], who demonstrated against a woman who uploaded controversial scantily dressed photos of herself to social media. The woman had been beaten by unknown assailants a few days earlier. [size=around 30]

On 2 January 2019, dozens of protesters gathered outside the Drevni Rim restaurant in Karaganda city demanding police investigation of a Kazakh man's death during a deadly mass brawl between groups of Kazakh and ethnic Armenian men two days earlier. [size=dozens]

On 26 December 2018, 10-15 relatives of the deceased victim in domestic violence case protested outside the city police department in Almaty city demanding investigators speed up the investigation process without further delay and transfer the case to the Alatau district police station where homicide initially took place. [size=10-15]
On 21 December 2018, about 20 workers protested at the Vostochny housing project's construction site in Almaty city demanding their back pay for 3 months of work. [size=about 20]

On 19 December 2018, about 40 homeowners protested near The Mausoleum of Khawaja Ahmed Yasawi in Turkistan city against the local government's private property buyout program which protesters complained was inadequately pricing residential homes in the neighborhood. Protesters demanded the authorities use market prices for private housing or else drop the program. [size=about 40]
On 17 December, a dozen activists gathered in Shymkent to commemorate the memory of those killed in Almaty in 1986 and those who died in the 2011 Zhanaozen protests. [size=a dozen]

On 16 December 2018, dozens of city residents gathered in Almaty city at the Memorial to the victims of Jeltoqsan protest in 1986 to pay respect and express their protest against political repression in Kazakhstan. Few protesters chanted We are not Slaves!. [size=dozens]
On 16 December, a group of activists gathered in Astana to commemorate the victims of the 2011 Zhanaozen protests and the 1986 Almaty uprising. [size=a group]

On 12 December 2018, about 20 bus drivers protested on the premises of the Almatyelectrotrans bus company in Almaty city against pay cuts and additional charges which protesters complained their employer takes it out of their monthly paycheck. Protesters demanded full pay without charges and cuts. [size=about 20]

On 11 December 2018, about 15 new homeowners protested outside their state subsidized housing project in Kokshetau city against poor quality of their apartments due to unsatisfactory construction of the building which protesters complained has multiple safety concerns and maintenance issues. [size=about 15]

On 5 December 2018, about 60 residents of Kojabakhy village of Kazaly district in Kyzylorda region protested outside the local clinic against its closure demanding the district authorities back down on its plan and leave a medical clinic open for operation. [size=about 60]

On 5 December 2018, about 15 workers of the Kamkor Esil company protested outside their office in the village of Yavlenka in Esil district of North Kazakhstan region demanding wages for one year of work or else protesters warned the company of an impending strike if their demands aren't met. [size=about 15]

On 4 December 2018, about 15 residents of Eltay village near Shymkent city protested against the local farm that closed off access to the local pastures for their livestock. Protesters complained farm owner left trenches around the villages which are making it difficult for villagers to get around the village. [size=about 15]

On 4 December 2018, about 20 residents of the local neighborhood near Turar village in Karasay district of Almaty region protested near their homes against bad roads, lack of drinking water and natural gas, and now no electricity supply calling for the district authorities to start fixing the local infrastructure. [size=about 20]

On 2 December, a person was arrested near Almaty for theft. According to his wife, law enforcement officers used violence leading to the hospitalization of the arrested individual with a concussion. [coded to the version of the civilian]

On 30 November, a gathering of ethnic Kazakhs that came back from Xinjiang occurred in Almaty calling Kazakh authorities to contribute to the release of relatives held at the re-education camps in China. [size=no report]

On 29 November 2018, about 20 residents of Semey city protested at the local city labor department's office against late payment fees and debt charges after protesters previously applied for the subsidized loans from the state funded unemployment program to start their own small businesses. Protesters complained they were not aware of the debt charges until they have started receiving red notices. [size=about 20]

On 29 November 2018, 15-20 residents of the Bereke micro-district in Petropavl city protested outside their apartment building against lack of heat supply to their homes demanding the city administration resolve the issue. [size=15-20]

On 22 November 2018, about 50 fishermen protested close to the Aral Sea near the town of Aralsk in Aral district of Kyzylorda region against fishing restrictions placed on them by the district authorities which is detrimental to their livelihoods, protesters complained. [size=about 50]

On 21 November 2018, about 10 oil workers of the Asco Expo Center company protested outside the regional administration's office in Aktobe city demanding the labor authorities intervene in their dispute with the company which failed to pay wages on time. [size=about 10]

Around 14 November, a dozen members of the Birdamlik movement were detained by unknown persons in the Jambyl Oblast [coded to Taraz] as they were on their way to Shymkent to participate in an assembly where the movement was supposed to be transformed into a political party. They were taken to the Kazakhstan-Kyrgyzstan border. Members of the movement believe the Uzbek authorities intervened to have them detained.

On 12 November 2018, about 20 residents of the local neighborhood near Kortayev road in Shymkent city protested outside their homes against irregular water supply project in the area which protesters complained is threatening integrity of their houses due to unsafe construction activity. [size=about 20]

On 9 November 2018, about 30 residents of the local neighborhood on Koichumanov street in Auezov district of Almaty city protested against construction of the nine storey apartment building next to their homes which protesters argued was negatively impacting safety of their homes demanding the city administration halt the project due to concerns. [size=about 30]
On 7 November, a man was beaten by law enforcement officers in Budarino after the owner of a cafe called the police fearing that the man would rob the cafe.
On 6 November 2018, it was reported that Kazakhstani law enforcements conducted a three days raid where 275 undocumented migrants were detained and 161 unauthorized immigrants deported.

On 1 November 2018, about 20 parents of students protested outside the education department's office in Aktobe city against privatization of the local state-owned education facility by the private firm demanding the city authorities reverse their previous decision on the disputed matter. [size=about 20]

On 30 October, two civilians claimed being beaten by three police officers in Karaganda after being stopped by the traffic police. The police reported that the civilians were stopped for being intoxicated and for insulting law enforcement officers. [coded to the version of the civilian]

On 25 October 2018, about 10 new homeowners protested outside their apartment building in Aktobe city against lack of heat supply which protesters blamed on the construction company. Protesters complained they are forced to abandon their apartments because of it due to approaching cold season. [size=about 10]

On 23 October 2018, about 7 former employees of the local bookmaking firm protested outside the firm's shop in the town of Taraz in Zhambyl region demanding unpaid wages which their former employer owed protesters for months of work. [size=about 7]

On 22 October 2018, about 50 protesters, of whom many were women, demonstrated outside the city administration's office in Aktobe city against privatization of the state-run daycares by the private businesses which protested argued will be having a negative impact on their children. [size=about 50]

On 22 October 2018, 20-30 private land plot owners protested at the district court in Arshaly town against the town administration's lawsuit intending to take their plots away from them. Protesters chanted they won't let the authorities to annul their ownership rights. [size=20-30]

On 16 October 2018, 20-30 former workers of the cement plant protested outside the factory near the town of Khantau in Moiynkum district of Zhambyl region demanding their back pay which protesters complained the company owes them for months of work. [size=20-30]

On 16 October, residents of Almaty Oblast' staged a protest against drivers by blocking a regional highway and protesting against traffic rules' negligence (ignoring zebra crossings in particular). [size=no report]

On 15 October 2018, about 20 residents of Kyzylorda city protested outside their apartment building against construction of the commercial property in their backyard by the city councilman demanding the authorities probe local official for alleged corruption and halt construction activity. [size=about 20]
On 12 October 2018, the Yakyn Inkar organization was recognized as an 'extremist' organization by the general Prosecutor's office in Astana.

On 11 October 2018, about 10 members of the visually impaired community protested at their Committee's office in Atyrau city against the new leadership of the group demanding more suitable candidates take charge of office to represent them. [size=about 10]

On 10 October 2018, 20-30 first time homeowners protested at the city administration in Nur-Sultan city demanding a meeting with a Mayor to address their concerns regarding a prolonged property dispute between the authorities and private developer which left protesters unable to exercise ownership rights for apartments. [size=20-30]

On 3 October 2018, about 20 activists and citizens protested outside the old Soviet security service building in Almaty city against planned purchase of the building by the private company demanding the building remains as a historical site in the city. [size=about 20]

On 1 October 2018, about 40 residents of Asysaga village in Enbekshikazakh district of Almaty region protested against alleged takeover of the nearby land by the foreign company with local official's involvement whom protesters accused of corruption. On 28 September 2018, about 20 residents of Rakhat neighborhood in Alatau district of Almaty city protested near their homes against delay with the natural gas supply project in the area demanding the utility company finish the project. Protesters complained they have invested in the project early on but there haven't been any results yet. [size=about 20]

On 26 September 2018, about 15 residents of Burkutty village in Karkaraly district of Karagandy region protested against the nearby chemical storage facility which protesters demanded the local authorities close down due to environmental and public health concerns in the area. [size=about 15]
As reported on 25 September, residents of Taldykorgan held a protest against poor living conditions in the suburbs, demanding that the authorities should improve housing facilities. [size=no report]

On 24 September 2018, about 20 residents of Yntymak village near the town of Taldykorgan in Almaty region protested against lack of water and power supply in the village, and poor condition of roads demanding the town administration fix the local issues which protesters argued haven't been addressed for more than a decade. [size=about 20]

On 19 September 2018, 15-20 victims of the fraudulent travel agency scheme protested outside the police department in Ust-Kamenogorsk city demanding the law enforcement agency investigate the travel firm for criminal offences and recover their funds. [size=15-20]

On 18 September 2018, about 30 residents of Baidala village in Zhetisay district of Turkistan region protested in town against lack of natural gas supply demanding the local authorities deliver on its previous promises to supply the whole township with gas one year earlier. [size=about 30]

On 14 September 2018, about 15 residents of Zhapek batyr village in Iliskiy district of Almaty region protested against incomplete water supply project in town demanding the local administration probe the project for using poor quality construction materiel. [size=about 15]

On 6 September 2018, a group of parents of Kazakh schoolgirls staged a protest in Zhaylybaev. The protesters demanded the repeal of the recently adopted law, according to which schoolgirls were not allowed to wear hijabs in school. The protest was dispersed by the police and the protesters were charged with administrative fines. [size=no report]

On 5 September 2018, 15-20 residents of Quschoqy village in Karagandy region protested against lack of ambulance service care in town demanding the authorities bring back original paramedic service to the village which was closed six months ago. Protesters complained they have to drive nearly one hour to reach the closest ambulance station. [size=15-20]

On 4 September 2018, around 30 women held a protest outside a school in Ferdowsi near the city of Turkistan against a new rule that forbids their daughters to wear a headscarf to school. The day before several girls were sent home for wearing headscarves. [size=around 30]

On 29 August 2018, about 20 residents of Kazatkom village in Enbekshikazakh district of Almaty region protested against the water supply project in their township demanding the local authorities stop the construction activity because they already have water supply infrastructure. [size=about 20]

On 28 August 2018, about 10 farmers protested near the village of Koksu in Shardara district of Turkistan region against lack of irrigation water supply in the area demanding the local authorities resolve their concerns due to its negative impact on their crop fields. [size=about 10]

On 27 August 2018, about 6 small retail food business owners protested on the Almaty-Tashkent freeway near the village of Sharapkhana in Kazygurt district of Turkistan region against demolition of their shops by the local authorities demanding halt to illegal activity as protesters claimed. [size=about 6]

On 24 August 2018, about 20 residents of the apartment building in Petropavl city protested against the utility company's unilateral action to cut hot water supply to their homes after protesters refused to install measuring devices for billing. Protesters called for the city authorities to intervene in the dispute between the parties. [size=about 20]

On 24 August 2018, 10-15 homeowners protested in Atyrau city against the city administration's plan to evict them and demolith their properties after failed negotiation between the parties on asking prices for private homes which protesters argued were reasonable but the city officials refused to pay. [size=10-15]

On 10 August, three women held a rally with placards in Almaty to encourage people to talk openly about menstruation. Some passing men grabbed the posters of the activists and tried to take a camera from a journalist. [size=3]

On 10 August, a massive fight that started the day before continued in Akshukur, Aktau region, where two groups of local residents armed with sticks, knives or iron pipes clashed with each other seeking revenge for the previous day, resulting in various injuries.

On 10 August 2018, about 15 residents of Karasay district protested near the village of Shamalgan in Almaty region against lack of drinking water supply in their village demanding the local administration fix the issue. [size=about 15]

On 9 August, a massive fight occurred in Akshukur, Aktau region, when two groups of local residents armed with sticks, knives or iron pipes clashed with each other; clashes continued the following day, when they gathered for revenge. As a result, one man died and several suffered various injuries. Later, over 30 participants were detained and punished by the court.

On 5 August, Kazakh and Russian border guards conducted joint raids in Zhanybek district. During the raids 150 border violators were detained.

On 31 July 2018, about 15 residents of Kapchagay township in Almaty region protested near their homes against lack of electricity supply in their neighborhood demanding the local authorities address their concerns. [size=about 15]

On 30 July, in Shymkent, a protest was held near the Ortalyk Bazaar market against the demolition of dozens of outlets located there and recognized by the court as illegally constructed has begun today. The participants expressed their dissatisfaction with the progress of the state program on housing construction. The protest ended up with the detention of some of the participants that were taken by the police to Bostandyk police department. [size=no report]

On 27 July, a clash erupted between a group of miners and guards at a gold mine in Zholymbet, Akmola region. One guard was killed and one of the miners injured. According to the guards, around 25 armed miners attacked them with firearms to steal gold. According to the miners, however, they numbered only 11, were unarmed, and only threw stones when guards started to beat them after they caught them mining illegally. [coded according to the guards' version]

On 25 July, dozens of participants of the 'Provide people with housing' mortgage loans association held a protest near the building of the National Bank in Almaty demanding the resignation of the head of the department for the protection of consumers of financial services and external communications. The protest ended up with the detention of some of the participants that were taken by the police to Bostandyk police department. [size=dozens]

On 24 July 2018, about 40 residents of the Murat community neighborhood in Semey city protested near their homes against lack of electricity supply to their households due to legal dispute demanding the local authorities resolve the issue and lower utility fees for protesters. [size=about 40]

On 20 July 2018, about 150 workers of the Kelun-Kazfarm pharmaceutical company protested outside the factory in Kokozek village of Karasay district in Almaty region against poor working conditions at the plant. Protesters demanded the company management address their complaints regarding long working hours, sick leave, day offs and labor contracts. [size=about 150]

On 19 July 2018, about 15 residents of Tyumenka village in Akkayin district of North Kazakhstan region protested near their homes against lack of drinking water supply in their village demanding the district administration fix the issue. Protesters complained their demands were ignored by the local authorities on numerous occasions. [size=about 15]

On 19 July 2018, 20-30 semi-truck drivers, mainly Uzbek nationals, protested at the border crossing post near the village of Kaplanbek in Saryagash district of Turkistan region against long delay on the Kazakh-Uzbek border passing, calling for the authorities in two countries resolve the bottleneck issue. [size=20-30]

On 18 July 2018, about 20 tenants of the newly built residential apartment building in Almaty city protested in their backyard against power outage for three days demanding the city authorities intervene to resume electricity supply back on. [size=about 20]

On 16 July 2018, about 15 residents of Tyulkubas village in Tulkibas district of Turkistan region protested near their homes against lack of drinking water supply in the village demanding the local authorities fix the issue. [size=about 15]

On 13 July 2018, about 30 residents of Koyandy village in Tselinogradsky district of Aqmola region protested against lack of drinking water supply in the village demanding the local authorities address the issue. [size=about 30]

On 12 July 2018, about 15 residents of Talgar township in Almaty region protested near their homes against lack of access to drinking water in their neighborhood demanding the local authorities provide water supply. [size=about 15]

On 11 July 2018, about 10 workers of the Stratus-Oil petroleum supply company protested outside the company's main office in the town of Aksukent in Sayram district of Turkistan region demanding their backpay which protesters complained they couldn't receive for more than a year. [size=about 10]

On 9 July 2018, about 30 workers of the cement plant near Khantau township in Moiykum district of Zhambyl region protested outside the workplace demanding their wages for 5 months of work which the company has reportedly failed to do. [size=about 30]

On 4 July 2018, about 10 construction workers protested outside the Zhubanov state university main building in Aktobe city demanding university dean pays them for previous work which protesters claimed have done for education official. Dean has denied having any link to protesters. [size=about 10]

On 3 July 2018, about 10 first time home buyers were detained by riot police for protesting outside the Komsomolsky residential apartment building project construction site in Nur-Sultan city after protesters accused the developer company of violating their rights leaving them without promised homes which protesters paid for. As reported on 27 June, around 10 people held a protest outside the Chinese consulate in Astana demanding the release of their ethnic Kazakh relatives who are held in detention camps in Xinjiang. [size=around 10]

On 26 June 2018, about 30 residents of Kenes village in Merki district of Zhambyl region protested against overpriced gas supply project by the private company in their township demanding the local authorities opt out for the state funded project instead which would dramatically lower the cost of the gas supply to their households. On 25 June 2018, a scuffle broke out between a group of people from the Leninski neighborhood of Pavlodar city and the road construction company workers after local residents blocked the road to the company trucks in a heated disagreement regarding road quality in the neighborhood. [size=no report]

On 23 June, a visually impaired man sitting in a park in Kostanay was detained, beaten and choked by the police, resulting in severe facial injuries and hospitalization. The man claimed he was detained arbitrarily, however, the court sentenced him to three days in jail for staging a protest on the grounds that he was wearing a blue t-shirt - the color of the opposition party. Authorities have been known to detain several people for wearing blue colors. A video of the incident was widely spread on social media.

On 23 June, dozens of people were detained in different cities of Kazakhstan after the leader of the movement 'Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan' (DVK), called for protests. In Alma-Ata, the police fenced the proposed meeting place, and then stopped and interrogated everyone who was approaching the barriers. According to Radio Liberty correspondents, at least 10 people were taken to the police bus. Human rights activist, director of the Kazakhstan Bureau for Human Rights, reported that the journalist of the bureau was also detained. [size=at least 10]

On 23 June, a few dozen of people were detained in the city of Shymkent in Kazakhstan during the protest called by the leader of the movement 'Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan' (DVK). [size=a few dozen]

On 8 June 2018, about 15 residents of Ortagash village in Zerendi district of Aqmola region protested against takeover of the nearby forest land by private businessman whom protesters accused of destroying the local environment after illegal logging of forest trees previously. On 8 June 2018, about 10 retail shop owners protested at the Karagash shopping plaza in Taldykorgan township against demolition of their shops by the local authorities due to fire safety concerns. [size=about 10]

On 31 May, several individuals gathered in order to lay flowers to commemorate victims of political repression in Almaty. Some of them were briefly detained by law enforcers, because the meeting was not sanctioned. The exact number of participants was not revealed. [size=several]

On 31 May 2018, 20-30 ethnic Kazakh protesters demonstrated outside the Chinese Consulate in Almaty city against mass imprisonment of their family members and relatives in China's Xinjiang province demanding their release. [size=20-30]

On 30 May 2018, more than 10 residents of a neighborhood in Ust-Kamenogorsk city protested outside their homes against construction of the residential apartment building next to their properties demanding the authorities intervene to stop the project. On 29 May 2018, about 60 victims of a flooding event protested outside the city administration's office in Semey city demanding fast relief aid and assistance for the households affected by the natural disaster. On 25 May 2018, 10-15 residents of Koksaek village in Tole Bi district of Turkistan region protested against disruption of gas supply to their households and irregular gas bills form the utility company which protesters blamed on the third party supplier. [size=10-15]

On 24 May 2018, about 20 private landowners protested near their homes in Kuat microdistrict near Otegen Batyr township of Ili district in Almaty region against the regional administration's plan to cancel their land ownership rights due to illegal sale of land more than a decade ago by the local district authorities which protesters argued wasn't disclosed to them at the time and thus they are not at fault. On 22 May 2018, about 30 workers of the municipal maintenance company protested at the company headquarters in Aktobe city demanding their wages for 3 months of work which protesters complained they have yet to receive but unable to due to unknown whereabouts of the company management. On 22 May 2018, about 100 oil workers, of the Kazmunaigaz state-owned company's affiliate Oil Services Company, protested in Mangistau town against increasing workload at the oil projects and pressure from management on workers to resign due to layoffs. On 17 May 2018, dozens of Agadyr village residents in Karagandy region protested against construction of the railroad depot to store and transport sulfuric acid near their residencies. Protesters categorically opposed the project demanding the authorities take it elsewhere. [size=dozens]
On 16 May, residents of Taldykorgan held rallies along potholes in the roads of the city against the poor conditions of roads and road works that were carried out. [size=no report]

On 15 May 2018, about 30 auto parts shop owners protested at the Jibek-Joly auto parts market in Almaty city against the market management's announcement to increase rent. Protesters complained rising rental fee is having a negative impact on their income. [size=about 30]

On 12 May 2018, a group of Akadyr village residents in Karaganda region protested outside the town administration against the copper processing company's plan to build a sulfuric acid storage facility in their town demanding to stop all construction activity. [size=no report]

On 10 May 2018, the Kazakh authorities detained a group of supporters of the Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan political group outside the EU Representative Office in Nur-Sultan city who appear to have rallied in response to a statement opposing Murat Tungishbaev's extradition from Kyrgyzstan, where he had been arrested, to Kazakhstan. On 10 May 2018, about 10 people and supporters of the Democratic Choise of Kazakhstan rallied in Uralsk city response to a statement opposing blogger's extradition from Kyrgyzstan, where he had been arrested, to Kazakhstan. On 10 May 2018, the Kazakh authorities detained a group of supporters of the Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan political group in Almaty city who rallied in response to a statement opposing Murat Tungishbaev's extradition from Kyrgyzstan, where he had been arrested, to Kazakhstan. On 10 May 2018, about 20 supporters of the banned Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan political group protested near Abai theatre in Semey city against political repression demanding the release of political prisoners, freedom of speech and political reforms in the country. [size=about 20]

On 3 May 2018, about 20 auto parts shop owners protested at the Car city market in Almaty city against abrupt closure of the market without advance notice which has disrupted their businesses. On 2 May 2018, about 6 clients of the defaulting Astana bank protested at the branch office in Shymkent city demanding their deposits back which prompted branch managers to call for armed private security guards to excort protesters out of the office building.
