On 25 April 2018, about 7 laid off medics, who were previously employed at the local Tuberculosis clinic, protested outside the Kazaly district administration's office in Ayteke Bi township demanding the authorities provide them with jobs after promising to have them employed two months earlier. On 20 April 2018, about 15 residents of Kara-Bulak village in Sayram district of Turkistan region protested against the local slaughterhouse demanding the authorities remove it from the township due to public health concerns. [size=about 15]

On 13 April 2018, about 20 residents of Jibek-Joly village outside Nur-Sultan city protested near the main highway against lack of access to the road toward the country's capital after the authorities failed to connect their town to the main highway. [size=about 20]

Around 12 April 2018, 15-20 parents of children with diabetes and cancer diseases protested at the regional health department's office in Uralsk city demanding prescription drugs for their kids which are in short supply at the local pharmacy stores. [size=15-20]

In the night of 5-6 April, a bus with Kyrgyz number plates was shot at in Aktobe region. The bus driver was injured.

On 5 April 2018, 20-30 residents of Bektobe village and neighboring Kyzylsharyk town in Zhambyl region protested at the nearby construction site against the authorities plan to build a medical clinic at the location due to its proximity to the local cemetery which was disturbed during construction. On 4 April 2018, about 15 residents of the Shchuchinsk township in Akmola region protested against the local administration's misleading record regarding their housing units that prevented the residents to register their owenership of the property. [size=about 15]

On April 3rd, online content related to the Democratic Choice of Kazakhstan (recently declared as an 'extremist' by state authorities) has been blocked on several websites and social media channels. On 2 April 2018, about 20 relatives of the previously court acquitted family members protested outside the Prosecutor's Office in Aktobe city against the prosecution's motion to re-open the case and charge suspects with criminal offences. [size=about 20]

On 29 March 2018, about 30 construction workers protested on the premises of the Kazakhs state funded Nurly-Jer housing project in Taldykorgan township demanding their wages in full for 3 months of work. On 26 March 2018, several relatives of imprisoned family member protested outside the regional Prosecutor's Office in Aktobe city demanding thorough investigation of his case. On 15 March 2018, more than 10 residents of Alatau district of Almaty city protested in their neighborhood demanding the district administration finish the construction project nearby and fix the local road. On 11 March, a prisoner was tortured to death by prison guards in a prison near Dolinka, Karaganda region. On 5 March 2018, a riot involving 15-20 residents of Akjar village in Zhambyl region broke out during a discussion between rioters and local farming business owner after villagers demanded their land plots back which businessman refused to do so. On 5 March 2018, about 20 residents of the newly-built subsidized housing project in Almaty city protested outside their homes demanding the local municipality fix an issue of heating supply overcharge which protesters complained they were unaware of until they moved in to their new homes. [size=about 20]

On 28 February, residents of Aktau gathered in the City Hall, complaining about the costs of utilities. According to them, the bills were unjustly high. The authorities later decided to involve and promised to solve the situation. [size=no report]

On 28 February 2018, about 15 construction workers protested outside the AktobeElectroSetStroi company's office in Aktobe city demanding their wages for months of work. Protesters accused the firm management of ignoring their calls to avoid paying owed salaries. [size=about 15]

On 28 February 2018, 15-20 residents of Karaboget village in Sarkand district of Almaty region protested in town demanding their land plots returned back to them by the local farmer who claimed the agricultural land was acquired by his father legally more than 20 years ago. Protesters called for the law enforcement agencies to get involved in their land dispute. [size=15-20]

On 28 February 2018, about 20 residents of Tuzdybastau village in Almaty region protested near their flooded homes against local officials after inaction from the authorities to prevent seasonal flooding in the village. Protesters demanded governor of Almaty region dismiss a number of district officials for negligence. [size=about 20]

On 26 February 2018, 5-10 drivers of the private moving services protested in Uralsk city against high price of liquefied natural gas for heavy duty trucks demanding the authorities lower LNG prices for businesses. [size=5-10]

On 22 February 2018, about 10 kidney dialysis patients protested outside the regional health department in Shymkent city demanding the medical clinic prescribes them their original medication which was replaced by a new drug of a poor quality, protesters claimed. [size=about 10]

On 21 February 2018, 15-20 residents of Altyntobe village in Abai district of Shymkent city protested outside the local mosque against illegal takeover of surrounding land by private businesses which protesters complained has negatively impacted their livestock. Protesters demanded the local authorities intervene in their land dispute. [size=15-20]

On 21 February 2018, about 15 victims of a fraudulent hedge fund scheme gathered outside the Nur-Karjy company's office in Semey city demanding their funds back after police launched criminal investigation into the company's financial activity. [size=about 15]

On 19 February 2018, about 5 medics and paramedics of the Tolebi district hospital protested on the facility premises in Koksaek village against the hospital's chief-doctor and his assistant accusing him of an assault on fellow doctor and abuse of power. Protesters demanded the health authorities probe hospital management for wrongdoing. [size=about 5]
Police Forces of Kazakhstan (1990-2019) National Security Committee

On 15 February, large-scale raids were carried out across the southern Kazakhstan, tackling corruption and smuggling over the borders. 29 individuals were arrested, including several Kyrgyz citizens, among them a member of the Kyrgyz parliament. Tensions between both states increased immediately. The former MP was later sentenced to 10 years in prison; his co-defendants were given from 3 to 14 years.

On 14 February, several residents of Astana gathered in front of the President's office, protesting against the alleged conviction of their children (on different charges). Although the protesters later decided to voluntarily disperse, they were taken to the police station and then to the court by law enforcers. [size=several]

On 13 February 2018, about 20 residents of Karatal village in Aktobe region protested against the local authorities enforced zoonotic quarantine after outbreak of brucellosis disease which has infected domesticated livestock in town. Protesters complained the district administration took their infected cattle away which has negatively impacted the local population. [size=about 20]

On 10 February 2018, about 10 employees of Ak Erkesh daycare facility protested at the local Department of Education in Aktobe city demanding their wages for 4 months. Protesters called for the authorities to resolve their pay issue wihout further delay. [size=about 10]

On 9 February 2018, about 10 construction workers protested outside the Taraz Leader Stroi company's office in Taraz township of Zhambyl region demanding their back pay for work which the company owes them, protesters claimed. [size=about 10]

On 6 February 2018, 20-30 livestock farmers and residents of Tole Bi district in Turkistan region protested in the village of Alatau against purchase of large swaths of nearby grazing land by private firms and businessmen which protesters argued puts their farms at disadvantage due to less access to surrounding land. [size=20-30]

On 6 February 2018, about 10 daycare workers protested at work station in Balykty township of Turkistan region against pay cuts which protesters complained slashed their wages by half making it difficult for them to sustain a living with such monthly salaries. [size=about 10]

On 5 February, around 400 protesters gathered in Astana. They all were former employers of local building companies, claiming that they had been illegally fired without paying compensation and demanding legal protection. [size=around 400]

On 5 February 2018, about 10 residents of Kainarbulak neighborhood in Shymkent city protested against delays to process property documents and bureaucratic procedures to legalize their homes which protesters blamed on the city authorities demanding officials resolve their concerns. [size=about 10]

On 5 February 2018, more than 10 tenants of the residential apartment building in the village of Karaotkel outside Nur-Sultan city protested against court-ordered eviction of their families from their homes demanding the local administration intervene in their dispute with landlord. [size=more than 10]

On 2 February 2018, about 5 former teachers and residents of Kainazar village in Almaty region protested outside the local high school against the principal whom protesters accused of abuse of power after their employment was terminated for alleged opposition to the school leadership. [size=about 5]

On 2 February 2018, about 10 homeowners protested near their houses in the outskirts of Kyzylorda city demanding the local authorities provide subsidies for more than 60 households in the area for relocation to safer location away from Syrdarya river due to flooding hazard which is making their homes unsafe to live in. [size=about 10]

On 2 February 2018, 10-15 tenants of the residential apartment building in Nur-Sultan city protested outside their homes demanding the city authorities provide standard heating to their flats after real estate developer defrauded them by selling unsuitable living space of which protesters became aware of after the fact. [size=10-15]

On 1 February 2018, about 40 workers protested at the apartment building construction site in Karaganda city demanding their unpaid wages for 4 months of work. Protesters complained they don't have a work contract with the company that hired them which makes it difficult to locate the employer. [size=about 40]

On 31 January 2018, about 15 residents of Karasay district protested outside the coal depot in the town of Shamalgan demanding equal distribution of coal to the local residents which protesters argued was driving coal prices up by middlemen and creating shortage in the middle of winter. [size=about 15]

On 31 January 2018, about 10 victims of fraudulent purchase agreement protested outside the construction materiel supply company's shop in Almaty city demanding their payments back after winning their lawsuit against the company in court. Protesters complained they have yet to be fully compensated. [size=about 10]

On 31 January 2018, about 10 tenants of the multi-storey apartment building in Turan neighborhood of Shymkent city protested outside their homes against malfunctioning water and heating supply meters in the building which are used by the municipal service to overcharge them for utilities, protesters complained. Protesters demanded the municipal service fix the issue. [size=about 10]
On 29 January 2018, 5-10 residents of Zhansugurov village in Almaty region protested outside their apartment building demanding adequate supply of heat to their homes. [size=5-10]

On 25 January 2018, about 15 residents of the town of Saran in Karaganda region protested outside the local heating plant against lack of heat in their homes in the dead of winter as temperatures plummeted. [size=about 15]

On 24 January 2018, 15-20 residents of Sholpan village in Urzhar district of East Kazakhstan region protested against the local medical clinic's malpractice whom they blamed for spreading hepatitis infection among children. Protesters accused medics of attemtping to cover up their misconduct. [size=15-20]

On 23 January, parents of children attending a school at Karaganda, Kazakhstan, gathered spontaneously and demanded temporary shutdown of the school due to the epidemic of Botkin's disease; eventually a vaccination of all children. [size=no report]

On 22 January 2018, about 15 residents of Taldykorgan district protested at the local coal depot in the town of Taldykorgan against rising cost of coal and lack of supply as tempereatures plummeted triggering demand for coal in the area. [size=about 15]

On 17 January 2018, 10-15 parents of school students protested outside the Maghjam Zhumabayev school in Atyrau city demanding the city authorities fix or renovate temporarily closed facility and let their children come back to resume studies at the location. Protesters complained their kids are forced to attend the neighboring schools which is causing great deal of inconvenience. [size=10-15]
On 13 January, a bomb was detonated under a car in the village of Ashysai, Enbekshikazakh district, Almaty region. One man was injured in the leg.

On January 11th, President of Kazakhstan ratified in Almaty an agreement on Kazakh-Turkmen state border demarcation. It means international consolidation of the border. The process of demarcation has been held since 2001.

On 11 January 2018, about 4 female parents of school students performed the Islamic prayer, Namaz, outside school 56 in Aktobe city in protest of the country's Ministry of Education's ban on wearing hijab by children in schools. Initially, protesters have met with a councilman to discuss their disagreement regarding restriction after which they stepped outside the school and prayed to express their opposition. [size=about 4]
On 10 January, shopkeepers of a shopping center held a protest in Taldykorgan to demand compensation for their shops that had burned down. [size=no report]

On 10 January, more than 20 female residents of an apartment block in Astana marched to the Presidential residency to demand a meeting with the President to stop their upcoming eviction. Police intervened and detained their leader for five days. 20 other women had to pay hefty fines. [size=more than 20]

On 8 January 2018, 5-10 parents of middle school students protested at the regional administration's office in Aktobe city against official ban on wearing hijab by children in schools demanding the authorities allow their kids to wear hijab in education facilities without restrictions. [size=5-10]

On 5 January 2018, about 10 residents of Bozaryk neighborhood in Shymkent city protested near their homes demanding the city authorities provide natural gas supply to their households as promised previously. [size=about 10]
Police Forces of Kazakhstan (1990-2019) Prison Guards

As reported on 9 January 2018, during the previous week [coded to 3 January] women were allegedly tortured in a detention center in Almaty. According to a report by human rights activists, the women (one pregnant) were beaten and bullied. The women also started a hunger strike.

On 3 January 2018, 20-30 villagers protested near their homes outside Petropavl city against the water company's demand to pay extra for maintenance of the local infrastructure accusing the water supplier of charging them more for profit. [size=20-30]
